intro: Rhapontica rhapontica, commonly known as the common rhapontic, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It has a creeping growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Rhapontica rhapontica is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
